documenttitle.text: Red Hat Enhancement Advisory: python-rtslib bug fix and enhancement update

note.text:
An update for python-rtslib is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux
8.
note.title: Topic

note.text:
For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat
Enterprise Linux 8.3 Release Notes linked from the References section.
note.title: Details

note.text: A flaw was found in Open-iSCSI rtslib-fb through versions 2.1.72, where it has weak permissions for /etc/target/saveconfig.json because the shutil.copyfile, instead of shutil.copy is used, and permissions are not preserved upon editing. This flaw allows an attacker with prior access to /etc/target/saveconfig.json to access a later version, resulting in a loss of integrity, depending on their permission settings. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

reference.Description: bz#1854723: CVE-2020-14019 python-rtslib: weak permissions for /etc/target/saveconfig.json

fullproductname.text: python-rtslib-0:2.1.73-2.el8 as a component of Red Hat Enterprise Linux BaseOS (v. 8)
